title: Aurigny introduce capped fares for travellers facing bereavement
text:
The company say the scheme will mean avoiding high costs for urgent last-minutes seats Aurigny is introducing capped fares for travellers facing bereavement or other family emergencies.
The Compassionate Fares scheme will limit the cost of an unexpected flight between Alderney or Guernsey and the UK to £75.
The airline say it will help keep costs down when a family member dies, or needs to travel for urgent medical care.
There'll also be flexibility for travellers who's travel plans are disrupted by family emergencies.
Commercial Director Malcolm Coupar said: "This will always be an incredibly stressful period in anyone’s life and we would like to do whatever we can to help support them and make it as easy as possible."
They're the first airline in the Channel Islands to introduce such a scheme and were inspired by Scottish airline Loganair, who do the same.
Last updated Mon 27 Feb 2017 Travel Alderney Guernsey
